’Cause you like me too much and I like you

“You Like Me Too Much” was composed in 1965 by George Harrison, it is thought that it is about his relationship to Pattie Boyd who was a struggling young model at the time. The two met on set for the “Hard Day’s Night” in 1964, where Pattie played a small role in the film as a schoolgirl fan (She is the blond in the hyperlinked video) and was immediately attracted to him. George wrote many songs about her like “If I needed someone”, “Something”, “For You Blue” and they got married in 1966 but she left George in 1974 for Eric Clapton.
